reasoning: Senile angiomas are common benign vascular proliferations appearing in adults >30 years. Population-based studies show ~10-15% of adults develop at least one angioma. Global incidence estimated ~18 per 100k person-years for symptomatic/treated cases. High prevalence accounts for frequent occurrence in aging populations.
source: Zaballos P et al. (2010). Dermoscopy of benign skin lesions by location. J Am Acad Dermatol. 62(4):554-560
